title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Master Bedroom Plan - Furniture, Lighting, Hardware", March 3, 1937
medium: Graphite, red, green, and blue color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower left: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower left: 8589/F.S.D./ANDERSON, OLSSON/P.S./D./3.3.37, 3/3/37,1, MASTERCR./ 3/22/37 OLS., 3/22/37, 1, MASTERCR./REVISION SENT; inscribed in graphite, lower center: ONE BED WITH THREE TUFLEX SHELVES ON THE LEFT SIDE/AND LEATHER COVERED NIGHTTABLE ON RIGHT SIDE/OVERALL SIZE - 8'-10 1/2" WIDE - 6' - 9 1/2" LONG - HEADBOARD HEIGHT 39"/HEADBOARD AND EXPOSED RAIL & BASE IN CAL. REDWOOD BURL/HEADBOARD TO HAVE TWO T-SHAPED METAL LEG SUPPORTS ON THE FLOOR/TO PREVENT BOARD FROM TIPPING/USE DOMES OF SILENCE/TUFLEX SHELVES HELD IN PLACE BY REMOVABLE DOWELS/NIGHTTABLE TO HOUSE SWITCHBOX & BELL BOX-REMOVABLE BACK FOR INSTALLATION OF PHONE BOXES/PHONE IS FASTENED TO AN EXTENSION SLIDE /INSTALL A PILOT LIGHT WITH SWITCH ABOVE SWITCH BOX/PROVIDE A SWITCH UNDER BOTTOM OF NIGHTTABLE FOR WALL PIN SPOT LIGHT/THREE TRAYS ATTACHED ON INSIDE OF DOOR - BULLET CATCH ON DOOR/INTERIOR OF NIGHT TABLE IN MAHOGANY/DOOR PULL POL. CHROM./ALL WIRE OUTLETS ON BACK OF NIGHT TABLE; dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Perspectives, plans, and elevations of master bedroom bed, night tables, and other furniture. Large double bed with California Redwood burl headboard; headboard extends beyond left and right side of bed; bed low to ground, no feet. Box base of bed in California Redwood burl with rounded front edges. Three Tuflex glass shelves affixed to left side of bed at headboard. Night table affixed to headboard at right side of bed; top surface in leather. Night table contains bell box, telephone, switch box, and two open spaces.
